Banking Officer (BBO III) Job at Mecer Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Mecer Consulting Limited is a World Class Consulting Firm with head office in Abuja, and branch in Lagos. We have over 20 years consulting experience, and have consulted for over 200 clients within Nigeria and West Africa. Our primary commitment is to meet the objectives and requirement of the customer specifications as defined in the clients’ contracts. Our job is to help businesses, NGO`s and international organizations improve the quality of their services, optimize operations, perform efficiently and effectively. We also offer ISO services and assist organizations to acquire international certifications and recognition needed to compete both locally and internationally.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Banking Officer (BBO III)
Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Source and acquire new SME and corporate clients
	Facilitate lending opportunities and provide financial solutions
	Manage and grow client relationships
	Recommend financial products based on client needs
	Monitor account performance and ensure compliance.


Requirements


	2+ years of experience in business or corporate banking
	Proximity to/understanding of markets aroundFestac, Trade-Fair axis
	Ability to analyze financial statements and work with data
	This role is crucial for driving business growth and achieving commercial banking targets.


Salary
N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@mecer.consulting using "BBO III" as the subject of the email.

Note: For more enquiries, contact 08134499701.

  "description": "APM Terminals is the global terminal operating arm of the A.P. Moller-Maersk Group. APM Terminals operates a Global Terminal Network of 76 operating port and terminal facilities and 117 Inland Services operations in 59 countries around the globe.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Terminal Manager

Job Requisition ID:&nbsp;R163532
Job Location: Apapa Port, Lagos
Reporting to: Country CEO, Nigeria

Role Overview


	As Terminal Manager at Apapa, you will lead the end-to-end operations of the terminal, ensuring seamless, safe, and efficient performance.
	You will drive operational excellence through Lean principles, empower teams to achieve high performance, and deliver sustainable business results.
	This role requires a combination of leadership, operational expertise, and business acumen to manage complex terminal operations while fostering a culture of continuous improvement.


Key Responsibilities
Operational Excellence &amp; Lean Leadership:


	Lead day-to-day terminal operations, ensuring seamless performance even amidst disruptions or challenges.
	Uphold and embed our Lean Operating System, driving SQDC (Safety, Quality, Delivery, and Cost) metrics with discipline and rigor.
	Promote a strong safety-first culture, ensuring full HSE compliance and continuous improvement in safety performance.
	Identify and manage operational bottlenecks, applying Lean tools to drive sustainable efficiency.
	Continuously improve processes, systems, and routines to elevate performance across all areas.


Performance Management:


	Translate organizational and terminal strategies into clear, actionable plans.
	Use data-driven decision-making to maintain consistently high operational performance.
	Implement and maintain operational standards, processes, and KPIs aligned with terminal and organizational goals.
	Ensure end-to-end delivery of productivity, efficiency, and cost leadership initiatives while exceeding industry benchmarks.
	Focus on system-wide results rather than isolated KPIs.


Leadership &amp; People Development:


	Lead by example, living the&nbsp;Lean operating system and a value-based culture.
	Build and guide high-performing teams, fostering collaboration, engagement, and empowerment.
	Coach and develop talent, ensuring succession planning for key positions.
	Connect with frontline employees to inspire and drive performance across the terminal.


What We&rsquo;re Looking For


	Proven experience in a senior leadership role within a complex, matrixed organisation - ideally in ports, terminals, or logistics.
	Strong understanding of Lean methodologies and a track record of applying them to drive business improvement.
	Demonstrated leadership in safety, cost optimisation, and performance management.
	Experience managing large teams and complex labour environments, including union negotiations.
	Strong business acumen with an ability to balance operational priorities, cost, and customer value.
	Excellent communication, influencing, and stakeholder management skills.
	Resilience, curiosity, and a relentless drive for continuous improvement.


Why This Role Matters:


	The Terminal Manager at Apapa plays a critical role in ensuring the terminal runs safely, efficiently, and profitably.
	By leading people, processes, and systems, you will directly influence operational excellence, customer satisfaction, and APM Terminals&rsquo; long-term success in West Africa.


Ideal Profile:


	You&rsquo;re a courageous, results-driven leader who thrives on challenges. You see problems as opportunities to improve, and you lead with empathy, discipline, and humility.
	You&rsquo;re energised by working with diverse teams, driving change, and building something better every day.

Terminal Manager Job at APM Terminals




        
    

        
        APM Terminals is the global terminal operating arm of the A.P. Moller-Maersk Group. APM Terminals operates a Global Terminal Network of 76 operating port and terminal facilities and 117 Inland Services operations in 59 countries around the globe.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Terminal Manager

Job Requisition ID: R163532
Job Location: Apapa Port, Lagos
Reporting to: Country CEO, Nigeria

Role Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As Terminal Manager at Apapa, you will lead the end-to-end operations of the terminal, ensuring seamless, safe, and efficient performance.
	You will drive operational excellence through Lean principles, empower teams to achieve high performance, and deliver sustainable business results.
	This role requires a combination of leadership, operational expertise, and business acumen to manage complex terminal operations while fostering a culture of continuous improvement.


Key Responsibilities
Operational Excellence & Lean Leadership:


	Lead day-to-day terminal operations, ensuring seamless performance even amidst disruptions or challenges.
	Uphold and embed our Lean Operating System, driving SQDC (Safety, Quality, Delivery, and Cost) metrics with discipline and rigor.
	Promote a strong safety-first culture, ensuring full HSE compliance and continuous improvement in safety performance.
	Identify and manage operational bottlenecks, applying Lean tools to drive sustainable efficiency.
	Continuously improve processes, systems, and routines to elevate performance across all areas.


Performance Management:


	Translate organizational and terminal strategies into clear, actionable plans.
	Use data-driven decision-making to maintain consistently high operational performance.
	Implement and maintain operational standards, processes, and KPIs aligned with terminal and organizational goals.
	Ensure end-to-end delivery of productivity, efficiency, and cost leadership initiatives while exceeding industry benchmarks.
	Focus on system-wide results rather than isolated KPIs.


Leadership & People Development:


	Lead by example, living the Lean operating system and a value-based culture.
	Build and guide high-performing teams, fostering collaboration, engagement, and empowerment.
	Coach and develop talent, ensuring succession planning for key positions.
	Connect with frontline employees to inspire and drive performance across the terminal.


What We’re Looking For


	Proven experience in a senior leadership role within a complex, matrixed organisation - ideally in ports, terminals, or logistics.
	Strong understanding of Lean methodologies and a track record of applying them to drive business improvement.
	Demonstrated leadership in safety, cost optimisation, and performance management.
	Experience managing large teams and complex labour environments, including union negotiations.
	Strong business acumen with an ability to balance operational priorities, cost, and customer value.
	Excellent communication, influencing, and stakeholder management skills.
	Resilience, curiosity, and a relentless drive for continuous improvement.


Why This Role Matters:


	The Terminal Manager at Apapa plays a critical role in ensuring the terminal runs safely, efficiently, and profitably.
	By leading people, processes, and systems, you will directly influence operational excellence, customer satisfaction, and APM Terminals’ long-term success in West Africa.


Ideal Profile:


	You’re a courageous, results-driven leader who thrives on challenges. You see problems as opportunities to improve, and you lead with empathy, discipline, and humility.
	You’re energised by working with diverse teams, driving change, and building something better every day.

Job Position: HR / Crewing Officer
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment type: Full-time

Role Description


	This is a full-time on-site role for an HR/Crewing Officer, located in Lekki.
	The HR/Crewing Officer will be responsible for managing crews, coordinating crewing activities, and overseeing operations management.
	Daily tasks include organizing and maintaining crew schedules, handling crew-related communications, and supporting the overall ship management operations.
	The HR/Crewing Officer will also ensure compliance with industry regulations and company policies.


Qualifications


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field
	Experience in the offshore Oil and Gas, Marine industry is a plus
	Managing Crews and Crewing skills
	Operations Management and Ship Management skills
	Strong Communication skills
	Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities
	Knowledge of industry regulations and standards


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: crew@deepwaterfze.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
